15#ifndef DNS_ADB_H
16#define DNS_ADB_H 1
17
18/*****
19 ***** Module Info
20 *****/
21
22/*! \file dns/adb.h
23 *\brief
24 * DNS Address Database
25 *
26 * This module implements an address database (ADB) for mapping a name
27 * to an isc_sockaddr_t. It also provides statistical information on
28 * how good that address might be.
29 *
30 * A client will pass in a dns_name_t, and the ADB will walk through
31 * the rdataset looking up addresses associated with the name. If it
32 * is found on the internal lists, a structure is filled in with the
33 * address information and stats for found addresses.
34 *
35 * If the name cannot be found on the internal lists, a new entry will
36 * be created for a name if all the information needed can be found
37 * in the zone table or cache. This new address will then be returned.
38 *
39 * If a request must be made to remote servers to satisfy a name lookup,
40 * this module will start fetches to try to complete these addresses. When
41 * at least one more completes, an event is sent to the caller. If none of
42 * them resolve before the fetch times out, an event indicating this is
43 * sent instead.
44 *
45 * Records are stored internally until a timer expires. The timer is the
46 * smaller of the TTL or signature validity period.
47 *
48 * Lameness is stored per <qname,qtype> tuple, and this data hangs off each
49 * address field. When an address is marked lame for a given tuple the address
50 * will not be returned to a caller.
51 *
52 *
53 * MP:
54 *
55 *\li The ADB takes care of all necessary locking.
56 *
57 *\li Only the task which initiated the name lookup can cancel the lookup.
58 *
59 *
60 * Security:
61 *
62 *\li None, since all data stored is required to be pre-filtered.
63 * (Cache needs to be sane, fetches return bounds-checked and sanity-
64 * checked data, caller passes a good dns_name_t for the zone, etc)
65 */
66
67/***
68 *** Imports
69 ***/
70
71#include <inttypes.h>
72#include <stdbool.h>
73
74#include <isc/lang.h>
75#include <isc/magic.h>
76#include <isc/mem.h>
77#include <isc/sockaddr.h>
78
79#include <dns/types.h>
80#include <dns/view.h>
81
82ISC_LANG_BEGINDECLS
83
84/***
85 *** Magic number checks
86 ***/
87
88#define DNS_ADBFIND_MAGIC ISC_MAGIC('a','d','b','H')
89#define DNS_ADBFIND_VALID(x) ISC_MAGIC_VALID(x, DNS_ADBFIND_MAGIC)
90#define DNS_ADBADDRINFO_MAGIC ISC_MAGIC('a','d','A','I')
91#define DNS_ADBADDRINFO_VALID(x) ISC_MAGIC_VALID(x, DNS_ADBADDRINFO_MAGIC)
92
93
94/***
95 *** TYPES
96 ***/
97
98typedef struct dns_adbname dns_adbname_t;
99
100/*!
101 *\brief
102 * Represents a lookup for a single name.
103 *
104 * On return, the client can safely use "list", and can reorder the list.
105 * Items may not be _deleted_ from this list, however, or added to it
106 * other than by using the dns_adb_*() API.
107 */
108struct dns_adbfind {
109 /* Public */
110 unsigned int magic; /*%< RO: magic */
111 dns_adbaddrinfolist_t list; /*%< RO: list of addrs */
112 unsigned int query_pending; /*%< RO: partial list */
113 unsigned int partial_result; /*%< RO: addrs missing */
114 unsigned int options; /*%< RO: options */
115 isc_result_t result_v4; /*%< RO: v4 result */
116 isc_result_t result_v6; /*%< RO: v6 result */
117 ISC_LINK(dns_adbfind_t) publink; /*%< RW: client use */
118
119 /* Private */
120 isc_mutex_t lock; /* locks all below */
121 in_port_t port;
122 int name_bucket;
123 unsigned int flags;
124 dns_adbname_t *adbname;
125 dns_adb_t *adb;
126 isc_event_t event;
127 ISC_LINK(dns_adbfind_t) plink;
128};
129
130/*
131 * _INET:
132 * _INET6:
133 * return addresses of that type.
134 *
135 * _EMPTYEVENT:
136 * Only schedule an event if no addresses are known.
137 * Must set _WANTEVENT for this to be meaningful.
138 *
139 * _WANTEVENT:
140 * An event is desired. Check this bit in the returned find to see
141 * if one will actually be generated.
142 *
143 * _AVOIDFETCHES:
144 * If set, fetches will not be generated unless no addresses are
145 * available in any of the address families requested.
146 *
147 * _STARTATZONE:
148 * Fetches will start using the closest zone data or use the root servers.
149 * This is useful for reestablishing glue that has expired.
150 *
151 * _GLUEOK:
152 * _HINTOK:
153 * Glue or hints are ok. These are used when matching names already
154 * in the adb, and when dns databases are searched.
155 *
156 * _RETURNLAME:
157 * Return lame servers in a find, so that all addresses are returned.
158 *
159 * _LAMEPRUNED:
160 * At least one address was omitted from the list because it was lame.
161 * This bit will NEVER be set if _RETURNLAME is set in the createfind().
162 */
163/*% Return addresses of type INET. */
164#define DNS_ADBFIND_INET 0x00000001
165/*% Return addresses of type INET6. */
166#define DNS_ADBFIND_INET6 0x00000002
167#define DNS_ADBFIND_ADDRESSMASK 0x00000003
168/*%
169 * Only schedule an event if no addresses are known.
170 * Must set _WANTEVENT for this to be meaningful.
171 */
172#define DNS_ADBFIND_EMPTYEVENT 0x00000004
173/*%
174 * An event is desired. Check this bit in the returned find to see
175 * if one will actually be generated.
176 */
177#define DNS_ADBFIND_WANTEVENT 0x00000008
178/*%
179 * If set, fetches will not be generated unless no addresses are
180 * available in any of the address families requested.
181 */
182#define DNS_ADBFIND_AVOIDFETCHES 0x00000010
183/*%
184 * Fetches will start using the closest zone data or use the root servers.
185 * This is useful for reestablishing glue that has expired.
186 */
187#define DNS_ADBFIND_STARTATZONE 0x00000020
188/*%
189 * Glue or hints are ok. These are used when matching names already
190 * in the adb, and when dns databases are searched.
191 */
192#define DNS_ADBFIND_GLUEOK 0x00000040
193/*%
194 * Glue or hints are ok. These are used when matching names already
195 * in the adb, and when dns databases are searched.
196 */
197#define DNS_ADBFIND_HINTOK 0x00000080
198/*%
199 * Return lame servers in a find, so that all addresses are returned.
200 */
201#define DNS_ADBFIND_RETURNLAME 0x00000100
202/*%
203 * Only schedule an event if no addresses are known.
204 * Must set _WANTEVENT for this to be meaningful.
205 */
206#define DNS_ADBFIND_LAMEPRUNED 0x00000200
207/*%
208 * The server's fetch quota is exceeded; it will be treated as
209 * lame for this query.
210 */
211#define DNS_ADBFIND_OVERQUOTA 0x00000400
212
213/*%
214 * The answers to queries come back as a list of these.
215 */
216struct dns_adbaddrinfo {
217 unsigned int magic; /*%< private */
218
219 isc_sockaddr_t sockaddr; /*%< [rw] */
220 unsigned int srtt; /*%< [rw] microsecs */
221 isc_dscp_t dscp;
222
223 unsigned int flags; /*%< [rw] */
224 dns_adbentry_t *entry; /*%< private */
225 ISC_LINK(dns_adbaddrinfo_t) publink;
226};
227
228/*!<
229 * The event sent to the caller task is just a plain old isc_event_t. It
230 * contains no data other than a simple status, passed in the "type" field
231 * to indicate that another address resolved, or all partially resolved
232 * addresses have failed to resolve.
233 *
234 * "sender" is the dns_adbfind_t used to issue this query.
235 *
236 * This is simply a standard event, with the "type" set to:
237 *
238 *\li #DNS_EVENT_ADBMOREADDRESSES -- another address resolved.
239 *\li #DNS_EVENT_ADBNOMOREADDRESSES -- all pending addresses failed,
240 * were canceled, or otherwise will
241 * not be usable.
242 *\li #DNS_EVENT_ADBCANCELED -- The request was canceled by a
243 * 3rd party.
244 *\li #DNS_EVENT_ADBNAMEDELETED -- The name was deleted, so this request
245 * was canceled.
246 *
247 * In each of these cases, the addresses returned by the initial call
248 * to dns_adb_createfind() can still be used until they are no longer needed.
249 */
250
251/****
252 **** FUNCTIONS
253 ****/
254
255
256isc_result_t
257dns_adb_create(isc_mem_t *mem, dns_view_t *view, isc_timermgr_t *tmgr,
258 isc_taskmgr_t *taskmgr, dns_adb_t **newadb);
259/*%<
260 * Create a new ADB.
261 *
262 * Notes:
263 *
264 *\li Generally, applications should not create an ADB directly, but
265 * should instead call dns_view_createresolver().
266 *
267 * Requires:
268 *
269 *\li 'mem' must be a valid memory context.
270 *
271 *\li 'view' be a pointer to a valid view.
272 *
273 *\li 'tmgr' be a pointer to a valid timer manager.
274 *
275 *\li 'taskmgr' be a pointer to a valid task manager.
276 *
277 *\li 'newadb' != NULL && '*newadb' == NULL.
278 *
279 * Returns:
280 *
281 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS after happiness.
282 *\li #ISC_R_NOMEMORY after resource allocation failure.
283 */
284
285void
286dns_adb_attach(dns_adb_t *adb, dns_adb_t **adbp);
287/*%
288 * Attach to an 'adb' to 'adbp'.
289 *
290 * Requires:
291 *\li 'adb' to be a valid dns_adb_t, created via dns_adb_create().
292 *\li 'adbp' to be a valid pointer to a *dns_adb_t which is initialized
293 * to NULL.
294 */
295
296void
297dns_adb_detach(dns_adb_t **adb);
298/*%
299 * Delete the ADB. Sets *ADB to NULL. Cancels any outstanding requests.
300 *
301 * Requires:
302 *
303 *\li 'adb' be non-NULL and '*adb' be a valid dns_adb_t, created via
304 * dns_adb_create().
305 */
306
307void
308dns_adb_whenshutdown(dns_adb_t *adb, isc_task_t *task, isc_event_t **eventp);
309/*%
310 * Send '*eventp' to 'task' when 'adb' has shutdown.
311 *
312 * Requires:
313 *
314 *\li '*adb' is a valid dns_adb_t.
315 *
316 *\li eventp != NULL && *eventp is a valid event.
317 *
318 * Ensures:
319 *
320 *\li *eventp == NULL
321 *
322 *\li The event's sender field is set to the value of adb when the event
323 * is sent.
324 */
325
326void
327dns_adb_shutdown(dns_adb_t *adb);
328/*%<
329 * Shutdown 'adb'.
330 *
331 * Requires:
332 *
333 * \li '*adb' is a valid dns_adb_t.
334 */
335
336isc_result_t
337dns_adb_createfind(dns_adb_t *adb, isc_task_t *task, isc_taskaction_t action,
338 void *arg, const dns_name_t *name, const dns_name_t *qname,
339 dns_rdatatype_t qtype, unsigned int options,
340 isc_stdtime_t now, dns_name_t *target, in_port_t port,
341 unsigned int depth, isc_counter_t *qc,
342 dns_adbfind_t **find);
343/*%<
344 * Main interface for clients. The adb will look up the name given in
345 * "name" and will build up a list of found addresses, and perhaps start
346 * internal fetches to resolve names that are unknown currently.
347 *
348 * If other addresses resolve after this call completes, an event will
349 * be sent to the <task, taskaction, arg> with the sender of that event
350 * set to a pointer to the dns_adbfind_t returned by this function.
351 *
352 * If no events will be generated, the *find->result_v4 and/or result_v6
353 * members may be examined for address lookup status. The usual #ISC_R_SUCCESS,
354 * #ISC_R_FAILURE, #DNS_R_NXDOMAIN, and #DNS_R_NXRRSET are returned, along with
355 * #ISC_R_NOTFOUND meaning the ADB has not _yet_ found the values. In this
356 * latter case, retrying may produce more addresses.
357 *
358 * If events will be returned, the result_v[46] members are only valid
359 * when that event is actually returned.
360 *
361 * The list of addresses returned is unordered. The caller must impose
362 * any ordering required. The list will not contain "known bad" addresses,
363 * however. For instance, it will not return hosts that are known to be
364 * lame for the zone in question.
365 *
366 * The caller cannot (directly) modify the contents of the address list's
367 * fields other than the "link" field. All values can be read at any
368 * time, however.
369 *
370 * The "now" parameter is used only for determining which entries that
371 * have a specific time to live or expire time should be removed from
372 * the running database. If specified as zero, the current time will
373 * be retrieved and used.
374 *
375 * If 'target' is not NULL and 'name' is an alias (i.e. the name is
376 * CNAME'd or DNAME'd to another name), then 'target' will be updated with
377 * the domain name that 'name' is aliased to.
378 *
379 * All addresses returned will have the sockaddr's port set to 'port.'
380 * The caller may change them directly in the dns_adbaddrinfo_t since
381 * they are copies of the internal address only.
382 *
383 * XXXMLG Document options, especially the flags which control how
384 * events are sent.
385 *
386 * Requires:
387 *
388 *\li *adb be a valid isc_adb_t object.
389 *
390 *\li If events are to be sent, *task be a valid task,
391 * and isc_taskaction_t != NULL.
392 *
393 *\li *name is a valid dns_name_t.
394 *
395 *\li qname != NULL and *qname be a valid dns_name_t.
396 *
397 *\li target == NULL or target is a valid name with a buffer.
398 *
399 *\li find != NULL && *find == NULL.
400 *
401 * Returns:
402 *
403 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS Addresses might have been returned, and events will be
404 * delivered for unresolved addresses.
405 *\li #ISC_R_NOMORE Addresses might have been returned, but no events
406 * will ever be posted for this context. This is only
407 * returned if task != NULL.
408 *\li #ISC_R_NOMEMORY insufficient resources
409 *\li #DNS_R_ALIAS 'name' is an alias for another name.
410 *
411 * Calls, and returns error codes from:
412 *
413 *\li isc_stdtime_get()
414 *
415 * Notes:
416 *
417 *\li No internal reference to "name" exists after this function
418 * returns.
419 */
420
421void
422dns_adb_cancelfind(dns_adbfind_t *find);
423/*%<
424 * Cancels the find, and sends the event off to the caller.
425 *
426 * It is an error to call dns_adb_cancelfind() on a find where
427 * no event is wanted, or will ever be sent.
428 *
429 * Note:
430 *
431 *\li It is possible that the real completion event was posted just
432 * before the dns_adb_cancelfind() call was made. In this case,
433 * dns_adb_cancelfind() will do nothing. The event callback needs
434 * to be prepared to find this situation (i.e. result is valid but
435 * the caller expects it to be canceled).
436 *
437 * Requires:
438 *
439 *\li 'find' be a valid dns_adbfind_t pointer.
440 *
441 *\li events would have been posted to the task. This can be checked
442 * with (find->options & DNS_ADBFIND_WANTEVENT).
443 *
444 * Ensures:
445 *
446 *\li The event was posted to the task.
447 */
448
449void
450dns_adb_destroyfind(dns_adbfind_t **find);
451/*%<
452 * Destroys the find reference.
453 *
454 * Note:
455 *
456 *\li This can only be called after the event was delivered for a
457 * find. Additionally, the event MUST have been freed via
458 * isc_event_free() BEFORE this function is called.
459 *
460 * Requires:
461 *
462 *\li 'find' != NULL and *find be valid dns_adbfind_t pointer.
463 *
464 * Ensures:
465 *
466 *\li No "address found" events will be posted to the originating task
467 * after this function returns.
468 */
469
470void
471dns_adb_dump(dns_adb_t *adb, FILE *f);
472/*%<
473 * This function is only used for debugging. It will dump as much of the
474 * state of the running system as possible.
475 *
476 * Requires:
477 *
478 *\li adb be valid.
479 *
480 *\li f != NULL, and is a file open for writing.
481 */
482
483void
484dns_adb_dumpfind(dns_adbfind_t *find, FILE *f);
485/*%<
486 * This function is only used for debugging. Dump the data associated
487 * with a find.
488 *
489 * Requires:
490 *
491 *\li find is valid.
492 *
493 * \li f != NULL, and is a file open for writing.
494 */
495
496isc_result_t
497dns_adb_marklame(dns_adb_t *adb, dns_adbaddrinfo_t *addr,
498 const dns_name_t *qname, dns_rdatatype_t type,
499 isc_stdtime_t expire_time);
500/*%<
501 * Mark the given address as lame for the <qname,qtype>. expire_time should
502 * be set to the time when the entry should expire. That is, if it is to
503 * expire 10 minutes in the future, it should set it to (now + 10 * 60).
504 *
505 * Requires:
506 *
507 *\li adb be valid.
508 *
509 *\li addr be valid.
510 *
511 *\li qname be the qname used in the dns_adb_createfind() call.
512 *
513 * Returns:
514 *
515 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS -- all is well.
516 *\li #ISC_R_NOMEMORY -- could not mark address as lame.
517 */
518
519/*
520 * Reasonable defaults for RTT adjustments
521 *
522 * (Note: these values function both as scaling factors and as
523 * indicators of the type of RTT adjustment operation taking place.
524 * Adjusting the scaling factors is fine, as long as they all remain
525 * unique values.)
526 */
527#define DNS_ADB_RTTADJDEFAULT 7 /*%< default scale */
528#define DNS_ADB_RTTADJREPLACE 0 /*%< replace with our rtt */
529#define DNS_ADB_RTTADJAGE 10 /*%< age this rtt */
530
531void
532dns_adb_adjustsrtt(dns_adb_t *adb, dns_adbaddrinfo_t *addr,
533 unsigned int rtt, unsigned int factor);
534/*%<
535 * Mix the round trip time into the existing smoothed rtt.
536 *
537 * Requires:
538 *
539 *\li adb be valid.
540 *
541 *\li addr be valid.
542 *
543 *\li 0 <= factor <= 10
544 *
545 * Note:
546 *
547 *\li The srtt in addr will be updated to reflect the new global
548 * srtt value. This may include changes made by others.
549 */
550
551void
552dns_adb_agesrtt(dns_adb_t *adb, dns_adbaddrinfo_t *addr, isc_stdtime_t now);
553/*
554 * dns_adb_agesrtt is equivalent to dns_adb_adjustsrtt with factor
555 * equal to DNS_ADB_RTTADJAGE and the current time passed in.
556 *
557 * Requires:
558 *
559 *\li adb be valid.
560 *
561 *\li addr be valid.
562 *
563 * Note:
564 *
565 *\li The srtt in addr will be updated to reflect the new global
566 * srtt value. This may include changes made by others.
567 */
568
569void
570dns_adb_changeflags(dns_adb_t *adb, dns_adbaddrinfo_t *addr,
571 unsigned int bits, unsigned int mask);
572/*%
573 * Change Flags.
574 *
575 * Set the flags as given by:
576 *
577 *\li newflags = (oldflags & ~mask) | (bits & mask);
578 *
579 * Requires:
580 *
581 *\li adb be valid.
582 *
583 *\li addr be valid.
584 */
585
586void
587dns_adb_setudpsize(dns_adb_t *adb, dns_adbaddrinfo_t *addr, unsigned int size);
588/*%
589 * Update seen UDP response size. The largest seen will be returned by
590 * dns_adb_getudpsize().
591 *
592 * Requires:
593 *
594 *\li adb be valid.
595 *
596 *\li addr be valid.
597 */
598
599unsigned int
600dns_adb_getudpsize(dns_adb_t *adb, dns_adbaddrinfo_t *addr);
601/*%
602 * Return the largest seen UDP response size.
603 *
604 * Requires:
605 *
606 *\li adb be valid.
607 *
608 *\li addr be valid.
609 */
610
611unsigned int
612dns_adb_probesize (dns_adb_t *adb, dns_adbaddrinfo_t *addr, int lookups);
613/*%
614 * Return suggested EDNS UDP size based on observed responses / failures.
615 * 'lookups' is the number of times the current lookup has been attempted.
616 *
617 * Requires:
618 *
619 *\li adb be valid.
620 *
621 *\li addr be valid.
622 */
623
624void
625dns_adb_plainresponse(dns_adb_t *adb, dns_adbaddrinfo_t *addr);
626/*%
627 * Record a successful plain DNS response.
628 *
629 * Requires:
630 *
631 *\li adb be valid.
632 *
633 *\li addr be valid.
634 */
635
636void
637dns_adb_timeout(dns_adb_t *adb, dns_adbaddrinfo_t *addr);
638/*%
639 * Record a plain DNS UDP query failed.
640 *
641 * Requires:
642 *
643 *\li adb be valid.
644 *
645 *\li addr be valid.
646 */
647
648void
649dns_adb_ednsto(dns_adb_t *adb, dns_adbaddrinfo_t *addr, unsigned int size);
650/*%
651 * Record a failed EDNS UDP response and the advertised EDNS UDP buffer size
652 * used.
653 *
654 * Requires:
655 *
656 *\li adb be valid.
657 *
658 *\li addr be valid.
659 */
660
661bool
662dns_adb_noedns(dns_adb_t *adb, dns_adbaddrinfo_t *addr);
663/*%
664 * Return whether EDNS should be disabled for this server.
665 *
666 * Requires:
667 *
668 *\li adb be valid.
669 *
670 *\li addr be valid.
671 */
672
673
674isc_result_t
675dns_adb_findaddrinfo(dns_adb_t *adb, const isc_sockaddr_t *sa,
676 dns_adbaddrinfo_t **addrp, isc_stdtime_t now);
677/*%<
678 * Return a dns_adbaddrinfo_t that is associated with address 'sa'.
679 *
680 * Requires:
681 *
682 *\li adb is valid.
683 *
684 *\li sa is valid.
685 *
686 *\li addrp != NULL && *addrp == NULL
687 *
688 * Returns:
689 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
690 *\li #ISC_R_NOMEMORY
691 *\li #ISC_R_SHUTTINGDOWN
692 */
693
694void
695dns_adb_freeaddrinfo(dns_adb_t *adb, dns_adbaddrinfo_t **addrp);
696/*%<
697 * Free a dns_adbaddrinfo_t allocated by dns_adb_findaddrinfo().
698 *
699 * Requires:
700 *
701 *\li adb is valid.
702 *
703 *\li *addrp is a valid dns_adbaddrinfo_t *.
704 */
705
706void
707dns_adb_flush(dns_adb_t *adb);
708/*%<
709 * Flushes all cached data from the adb.
710 *
711 * Requires:
712 *\li adb is valid.
713 */
714
715void
716dns_adb_setadbsize(dns_adb_t *adb, size_t size);
717/*%<
718 * Set a target memory size. If memory usage exceeds the target
719 * size entries will be removed before they would have expired on
720 * a random basis.
721 *
722 * If 'size' is 0 then memory usage is unlimited.
723 *
724 * Requires:
725 *\li 'adb' is valid.
726 */
727
728void
729dns_adb_flushname(dns_adb_t *adb, const dns_name_t *name);
730/*%<
731 * Flush 'name' from the adb cache.
732 *
733 * Requires:
734 *\li 'adb' is valid.
735 *\li 'name' is valid.
736 */
737
738void
739dns_adb_flushnames(dns_adb_t *adb, const dns_name_t *name);
740/*%<
741 * Flush 'name' and all subdomains from the adb cache.
742 *
743 * Requires:
744 *\li 'adb' is valid.
745 *\li 'name' is valid.
746 */
747
748void
749dns_adb_setcookie(dns_adb_t *adb, dns_adbaddrinfo_t *addr,
750 const unsigned char *cookie, size_t len);
751/*%<
752 * Record the COOKIE associated with this addresss. If
753 * cookie is NULL or len is zero the recorded COOKIE is cleared.
754 *
755 * Requires:
756 *\li 'adb' is valid.
757 *\li 'addr' is valid.
758 */
759
760size_t
761dns_adb_getcookie(dns_adb_t *adb, dns_adbaddrinfo_t *addr,
762 unsigned char *cookie, size_t len);
763/*
764 * Retieve the saved COOKIE value and store it in 'cookie' which has
765 * size 'len'.
766 *
767 * Requires:
768 *\li 'adb' is valid.
769 *\li 'addr' is valid.
770 *
771 * Returns:
772 * The size of the cookie or zero if it doesn't fit in the buffer
773 * or it doesn't exist.
774 */
775
776void
777dns_adb_setquota(dns_adb_t *adb, uint32_t quota, uint32_t freq,
778 double low, double high, double discount);
779/*%<
780 * Set the baseline ADB quota, and configure parameters for the
781 * quota adjustment algorithm.
782 *
783 * If the number of fetches currently waiting for responses from this
784 * address exceeds the current quota, then additional fetches are spilled.
785 *
786 * 'quota' is the highest permissible quota; it will adjust itself
787 * downward in response to detected congestion.
788 *
789 * After every 'freq' fetches have either completed or timed out, an
790 * exponentially weighted moving average of the ratio of timeouts
791 * to responses is calculated. If the EWMA goes above a 'high'
792 * threshold, then the quota is adjusted down one step; if it drops
793 * below a 'low' threshold, then the quota is adjusted back up one
794 * step.
795 *
796 * The quota adjustment is based on the function (1 / 1 + (n/10)^(3/2)),
797 * for values of n from 0 to 99. It starts at 100% of the baseline
798 * quota, and descends after 100 steps to 2%.
799 *
800 * 'discount' represents the discount rate of the moving average. Higher
801 * values cause older values to be discounted sooner, providing a faster
802 * response to changes in the timeout ratio.
803 *
804 * Requires:
805 *\li 'adb' is valid.
806 */
807
808bool
809dns_adbentry_overquota(dns_adbentry_t *entry);
810/*%<
811 * Returns true if the specified ADB has too many active fetches.
812 *
813 * Requires:
814 *\li 'entry' is valid.
815 */
816
817void
818dns_adb_beginudpfetch(dns_adb_t *adb, dns_adbaddrinfo_t *addr);
819void
820dns_adb_endudpfetch(dns_adb_t *adb, dns_adbaddrinfo_t *addr);
821/*%
822 * Begin/end a UDP fetch on a particular address.
823 *
824 * These functions increment or decrement the fetch counter for
825 * the ADB entry so that the fetch quota can be enforced.
826 *
827 * Requires:
828 *
829 *\li adb be valid.
830 *
831 *\li addr be valid.
832 */
833
834ISC_LANG_ENDDECLS
835
836#endif /* DNS_ADB_H */
837
